page.title: 03Boroma Questionaire Cont.
page.content: 35000. Although Boroma does have a water supply they cannot use it as they have no way of getting water up from the ground. Their diet consists of mainly Maize and other corn type products. Nowadays the people of Boroma are mainly settled farmers, not Nomads. Boroma today is a lot like Henley would have been about 200 years ago. In Boroma they use camels to help them, they also keep sheep, goats, chickens, and some cattle. Until about 100 years ago no-one stayed in Boroma. For a long period they didn't have a standard language, so their language was only written down in the past 50 years, when more people lived in Boroma. No-one in Boroma pronounces, or spells the name in the same way. Looking at some of the spellings you would never guess that the word was Boroma.
